title: How to Create a Christmas List for a Letter to Santa

steps.headline: Think about the toys you'd like to receive for Christmas.
steps.description: Perhaps you know a few without even looking, and can write these down without much help.

steps.headline: Look through catalogs from within the last year.
steps.description: Especially for those toys that are super-popular, getting it just right might be just what the list needs.

steps.headline: Think about any collections you may have.
steps.description: Maybe it's something you collect, or maybe something else you enjoy doing; it's not just going to be just "toys".

steps.headline: Look for the items that have more surreal value in them.

text: Think about the toys you'd like to receive for Christmas. Perhaps you know a few without even looking, and can write these down without much help. Look through catalogs from within the last year. Especially for those toys that are super-popular, getting it just right might be just what the list needs. Think about any collections you may have. Maybe it's something you collect, or maybe something else you enjoy doing; it's not just going to be just "toys". Look for the items that have more surreal value in them. Look at things you'll definitely need. For most who are reading this article, you are probably are going to school and what student wouldn't mind more pencils or pens or even crayons and a pair of scissors. That must be left up to you to decide. Look through magazines and newspapers, as the year progresses. Clip away any ideas of what Santa can get you for Christmas, and write these down on your list. Begin listing the items you would like to tell him.
